00048 //
00049 // CDirectSoundAudio::VInitialize                       - Chapter 12, page 406
00050 //
00051 bool CDirectSoundAudio::VInitialize(HWND hWnd)
00052 {
00053         if(m_Initialized)
00054                 return true;
00055 
00056         m_Initialized=false;
00057 
00058         SAFE_RELEASE( m_pDS );
00059 
00060         HRESULT hr;
00061 
00062         // Create IDirectSound using the primary sound device
00063         if( FAILED( hr = DirectSoundCreate8( NULL, &m_pDS, NULL ) ) )
00064                 return false;
00065 
00066         // Set DirectSound coop level 
00067         if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->SetCooperativeLevel( hWnd, DSSCL_PRIORITY) ) )
00068                 return false;
00069 
00070         if( FAILED( hr = SetPrimaryBufferFormat( 4, 22050, 16 ) ) )
00071                 return false;
00072 
00073         m_Initialized = true;
00074         m_AllSamples.clear();
00075         return true;
00076 }
00077 
00078 //
00079 // CDirectSoundAudio::SetPrimaryBufferFormat            - Chapter 12, page 407
00080 //
00081 HRESULT CDirectSoundAudio::SetPrimaryBufferFormat( 
00082         DWORD dwPrimaryChannels, 
00083     DWORD dwPrimaryFreq, 
00084     DWORD dwPrimaryBitRate )
00085 {
00086         // !WARNING! - Setting the primary buffer format and then using this
00087         // it for DirectMusic messes up DirectMusic! 
00088         //
00089         // If you want your primary buffer format to be 22kHz stereo, 16-bit
00090         // call with these parameters:  SetPrimaryBufferFormat(2, 22050, 16);
00091 
00092         HRESULT             hr;
00093         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSBPrimary = NULL;
00094 
00095         if( m_pDS == NULL )
00096                 return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00097 
00098         // Get the primary buffer 
00099         DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00100         ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00101         dsbd.dwSize        = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00102         dsbd.dwFlags       = DSBCAPS_PRIMARYBUFFER;
00103         dsbd.dwBufferBytes = 0;
00104         dsbd.lpwfxFormat   = NULL;
00105 
00106         if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &pDSBPrimary, NULL ) ) )
00107                 return DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00108 
00109         WAVEFORMATEX wfx;
00110         ZeroMemory( &wfx, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX) ); 
00111         wfx.wFormatTag      = (WORD) WAVE_FORMAT_PCM; 
00112         wfx.nChannels       = (WORD) dwPrimaryChannels; 
00113         wfx.nSamplesPerSec  = (DWORD) dwPrimaryFreq; 
00114         wfx.wBitsPerSample  = (WORD) dwPrimaryBitRate; 
00115         wfx.nBlockAlign     = (WORD) (wfx.wBitsPerSample / 8 * wfx.nChannels);
00116         wfx.nAvgBytesPerSec = (DWORD) (wfx.nSamplesPerSec * wfx.nBlockAlign);
00117 
00118         if( FAILED( hr = pDSBPrimary->SetFormat(&wfx) ) )
00119                 return DXUT_ERR( L"SetFormat", hr );
00120 
00121         SAFE_RELEASE( pDSBPrimary );
00122 
00123         return S_OK;
00124 }

00128 // CDirectSoundAudio::VShutdown                                 - Chapter 12, page 409
00129 //
00130 void CDirectSoundAudio::VShutdown()
00131 {
00132         if(m_Initialized)
00133         {
00134                 CAudio::VShutdown();
00135                 SAFE_RELEASE(m_pDS);
00136                 m_Initialized = false;
00137         }
00138 }

00141 //
00142 // CDirectSoundAudio::VInitAudioBuffer                                  - Chapter 12, page 409
00143 //   Allocate a sample handle for the newborn sound (used by CSoundResource) and tell you it's length
00144 //
00145 IAudioBuffer *CDirectSoundAudio::VInitAudioBuffer(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> soundResource)//const
00146 {
00147         const TCHAR* fileExtension = CAudio::FindExtFromSoundType(soundResource->GetSoundType());
00148 
00149     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00150         return NULL;
00151 
00152         switch(soundResource->GetSoundType())
00153         {
00154                 case SOUND_TYPE_OGG:
00155                 case SOUND_TYPE_WAVE:
00156                         // We support WAVs and OGGs
00157                         break;
00158 
00159                 case SOUND_TYPE_MP3:
00160                 case SOUND_TYPE_MIDI:   //If it's a midi file, then do nothin at this time... maybe we will support this in the future
00161                         assert(false && "MP3s and MIDI are not supported");
00162                         return NULL;
00163                         break;
00164 
00165                 default:
00166                         assert(false && "Unknown sound type");
00167                         return NULL;
00168         }//end switch
00169 
00170     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER sampleHandle;
00171 
00172     // Create the direct sound buffer, and only request the flags needed
00173     // since each requires some overhead and limits if the buffer can 
00174     // be hardware accelerated
00175     DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00176     ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00177     dsbd.dwSize          = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00178     dsbd.dwFlags         = 0;
00179     dsbd.dwBufferBytes   = soundResource->GetPCMBufferSize();
00180     dsbd.guid3DAlgorithm = GUID_NULL;
00181     dsbd.lpwfxFormat     = const_cast<WAVEFORMATEX *>(soundResource->GetFormat());
00182 
00183         HRESULT hr;
00184     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &sampleHandle, NULL ) ) )
00185     {
00186         return NULL;
00187     }
00188 
00189         // Add handle to the list
00190         IAudioBuffer *audioBuffer = (IAudioBuffer *)(GCC_NEW CDirectSoundAudioBuffer(sampleHandle, soundResource));
00191         m_AllSamples.insert( m_AllSamples.begin(), audioBuffer);
00192         
00193         return audioBuffer;
00194 
00195 }

00197 //
00198 // CDirectSoundAudio::VReleaseAudioBuffer       - Chapter 12, page 411
00199 //    Allocate a sample handle for the newborn sound (used by CSoundResource)
00200 //
00201 void CDirectSoundAudio::VReleaseAudioBuffer(IAudioBuffer *sampleHandle)//const
00202 {
00203         sampleHandle->VStop();
00204         m_AllSamples.remove(sampleHandle);
00205 }

00209 //
00210 CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::CDirectSoundAudioBuffer(
00211         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER sample, 
00212         shared_ptr<CSoundResource> resource) 
00213  : CAudioBuffer(resource) 
00214 { 
00215         m_Sample = sample; 
00216         FillBufferWithSound();
00217 }

00219 //
00220 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VGet                        - Chapter 12, page 412
00221 //
00222 void *CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VGet()
00223 {
00224         if (!VOnRestore())
00225                 return NULL;
00226 
00227         return m_Sample;
00228 }

00231 //
00232 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VPlay                               - Chapter 12, page 412
00233 //    Play a sound
00234 //
00235 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VPlay(int volume, bool looping)
00236 {
00237         VStop();
00238 
00239         m_Volume = volume;
00240         m_isLooping = looping;
00241 
00242         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = (LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER)VGet();
00243         if (!pDSB)
00244                 return false;
00245 
00246     pDSB->SetVolume( volume );
00247     
00248     DWORD dwFlags = looping ? DSBPLAY_LOOPING : 0L;
00249 
00250     return (S_OK==pDSB->Play( 0, 0, dwFlags ) );
00251 
00252 }//end Play

00255 //
00256 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VStop                               - Chapter 12, page 413
00257 //    Stop a sound
00258 //
00259 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VStop()
00260 {
00261         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = (LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER)VGet();
00262 
00263         if(!g_Audio->VActive())
00264                 return false;
00265 
00266    if( pDSB == NULL )
00267                 return false;
00268 
00269         m_isPaused=true;
00270     pDSB->Stop();
00271         return true;
00272 }
00273 
00274 //
00275 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VResume                                     - Chapter 12, page 413
00276 //    Resume a sound
00277 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VResume()
00278 {
00279         m_isPaused=false;
00280         return VPlay(VGetVolume(), VIsLooping());
00281 }
00282 
00283 //
00284 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VTogglePause                        - Chapter 12, page 413
00285 //    Pause a sound or Resume a Paused sound
00286 //
00287 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VTogglePause()
00288 {
00289         if(!g_Audio->VActive())
00290                 return false;
00291 
00292         if(m_isPaused)
00293         {
00294                 VResume();
00295         }
00296         else
00297         {
00298                 VStop();
00299         }
00300 
00301         return true;
00302 }//end TogglePause

00308 //
00309 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VIsPlaying                          - Chapter 12, page 413
00310 //
00311 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VIsPlaying() 
00312 {
00313         if(!g_Audio->VActive())
00314                 return false;
00315 
00316         DWORD dwStatus = 0;
00317         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = (LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER)VGet();
00318         pDSB->GetStatus( &dwStatus );
00319     bool bIsPlaying = ( ( dwStatus & DSBSTATUS_PLAYING ) != 0 );
00320 
00321         return bIsPlaying;
00322 }
00323 
00324 //
00325 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VSetVolume                          - Chapter 12, page 414
00326 //
00327 void CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VSetVolume(int volume)
00328 {
00329         if(!g_Audio->VActive())
00330                 return;
00331 
00332         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = (LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER)VGet();
00333 
00334         assert(volume>=0 && volume<=100 && "Volume must be a number between 0 and 100");
00335 
00336         // convert volume from 0-100 into range for DirectX
00337 
00338         float coeff = (float)volume / 100.0f;
00339         float range = (DSBVOLUME_MAX - DSBVOLUME_MIN);
00340         float fvolume = ( range * coeff  ) + DSBVOLUME_MIN;
00341 
00342         pDSB->SetVolume( LONG(fvolume) );
00343 
00344 }

00347 //
00348 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VOnRestore          - Chapter 12, page 415
00349 //    NOTE: Renamed from CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VRestore in the book
00350 bool CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VOnRestore()
00351 {
00352    HRESULT hr;
00353    BOOL    bRestored;
00354 
00355     // Restore the buffer if it was lost
00356     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( &bRestored ) ) )
00357         return NULL;
00358 
00359     if( bRestored )
00360     {
00361         // The buffer was restored, so we need to fill it with new data
00362         if( FAILED( hr = FillBufferWithSound( ) ) )
00363             return NULL;
00364     }
00365 
00366         return true;
00367 }
00368 
00369 //
00370 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::RestoreBuffer                       - Chapter 12, page 415
00371 //
00372 //    Restores the lost buffer. *pbWasRestored returns TRUE if the buffer was 
00373 //    restored.  It can also NULL if the information is not needed.
00374 //
00375 HRESULT CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::RestoreBuffer( BOOL* pbWasRestored )
00376 {
00377     HRESULT hr;
00378 
00379     if( m_Sample == NULL )
00380         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00381     if( pbWasRestored )
00382         *pbWasRestored = FALSE;
00383 
00384     DWORD dwStatus;
00385     if( FAILED( hr = m_Sample->GetStatus( &dwStatus ) ) )
00386         return DXUT_ERR( L"GetStatus", hr );
00387 
00388     if( dwStatus & DSBSTATUS_BUFFERLOST )
00389     {
00390         // Since the app could have just been activated, then
00391         // DirectSound may not be giving us control yet, so 
00392         // the restoring the buffer may fail.  
00393         // If it does, sleep until DirectSound gives us control.
00394         do 
00395         {
00396             hr = m_Sample->Restore();
00397             if( hr == DSERR_BUFFERLOST )
00398                 Sleep( 10 );
00399         }
00400         while( ( hr = m_Sample->Restore() ) == DSERR_BUFFERLOST );
00401 
00402         if( pbWasRestored != NULL )
00403             *pbWasRestored = TRUE;
00404 
00405         return S_OK;
00406     }
00407     else
00408     {
00409         return S_FALSE;
00410     }
00411 }
00412 
00413 //
00414 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::FillBufferWithSound                         - Chapter 12, page 416
00415 //
00416 HRESULT CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::FillBufferWithSound( void )
00417 {
00418     HRESULT hr; 
00419         VOID    *pDSLockedBuffer = NULL;         // a pointer to the DirectSound buffer
00420     DWORD   dwDSLockedBufferSize = 0;    // Size of the locked DirectSound buffer
00421     DWORD   dwWavDataRead        = 0;    // Amount of data read from the wav file 
00422 
00423     if( m_Sample == NULL )
00424         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00425 
00426     // Make sure we have focus, and we didn't just switch in from
00427     // an app which had a DirectSound device
00428     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( NULL ) ) ) 
00429         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
00430 
00431         int pcmBufferSize = m_Resource->GetPCMBufferSize();
00432     // Lock the buffer down
00433     if( FAILED( hr = m_Sample->Lock( 0, pcmBufferSize, 
00434                                  &pDSLockedBuffer, &dwDSLockedBufferSize, 
00435                                  NULL, NULL, 0L ) ) )
00436         return DXUT_ERR( L"Lock", hr );
00437 
00438     if( pcmBufferSize == 0 )
00439     {
00440         // Wav is blank, so just fill with silence
00441         FillMemory( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer, 
00442                     dwDSLockedBufferSize, 
00443                     (BYTE)(m_Resource->GetFormat()->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00444     }
00445     else 
00446         {
00447                 CopyMemory(pDSLockedBuffer, m_Resource->GetPCMBuffer(), pcmBufferSize);
00448                 if( pcmBufferSize < (int)dwDSLockedBufferSize )
00449                 {
00450             // If the buffer sizes are different fill in the rest with silence 
00451             FillMemory( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer + pcmBufferSize, 
00452                         dwDSLockedBufferSize - pcmBufferSize, 
00453                         (BYTE)(m_Resource->GetFormat()->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00454         }
00455     }
00456 
00457     // Unlock the buffer, we don't need it anymore.
00458     m_Sample->Unlock( pDSLockedBuffer, dwDSLockedBufferSize, NULL, 0 );
00459 
00460     return S_OK;
00461 }

00466 //
00467 // CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VGetProgress                                - Chapter 12, page 418
00468 //
00469 float CDirectSoundAudioBuffer::VGetProgress()
00470 {
00471         LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = (LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER)VGet(); 
00472         DWORD progress = 0;
00473 
00474         pDSB->GetCurrentPosition(&progress, NULL);
00475 
00476         float length = (float)m_Resource->GetPCMBufferSize();
00477 
00478         return (float)progress / length;
00479 }
